title: Inherited Property with Rental

scenario_info.name: Inherited Property Then Rented
scenario_info.description: Emma inherits her mother's home (which was mum's main residence) and then rents it out before selling more than 2 years after the date of death.

expected_result.notes: Since sold more than 2 years after death and Emma never lived there, no MRE applies for Emma's period.

applicable_rules: ITAA97 s118.195: 2-year disposal rule NOT met (sold 4+ years after death)
Cost base = Market value at date of death ($780,000)
Emma never established property as her main residence
ITAA97 s115.25: 50% CGT discount applies (inherited acquisition date)

property_history.description: Inherited from mother. Property was mother's main residence. Mother purchased in 1985.

properties.notes: Inherited property. Mother's MRE would have applied if sold within 2 years. Since sold after 4 years and rented entire time, no MRE for Emma.

user_query: I inherited my mother's home in 2020. She lived there her whole life. I rented it out and sold it in 2024. What is my CGT liability?
